name: v4.0.1
body: Fix Travis for release updates

name: v4.0.0
body:
Bump major version for go.mod update

* Add go.mod and remove glide.yaml
* Add semver suffix on import paths following go standard
* Bump to major version v4.0.0 since semver update is a breaking change

name: v3.4.9
body: Add support for `"over":"$"` to iterate transform over root level array, fix for #106

name: v3.4.8
body: transform spec now supports a `"keySeparator"` key which allows user to specify what character(s) delineate nested keys. The default remains `.` (which is current behavior) so this should be fully backwards compatible.

name: Release v3.4.7
body: Permanently fixes UUID dependency issue.

name: Release v3.4.6
body: Add support for `$unix` epoch to `timestamp` input and output format.

name: Release v3.4.5
body: Fix UUID dependency issue

name: Release v3.4.4
body: This is a bugfix release that ensures this project continues to be `go get`able after the breaking change in the github.com/satori/go.uuid package. No other changes to kazaam are made.

name: Release v3.4.3
body: Bug fixes

name: Release v3.4.2
body: Bug fixes for code added in v3.4.1 https://github.com/qntfy/kazaam/pull/66

name: Release v3.4.1
body: This release adds support for an optional `ignore` array in `Coalesce()`.

name: Release v3.4.0
body: This release adds the ability to delete keys.

name: Release v3.3.0
body: This release migrates from the [official buger/jsonparser](https://github.com/buger/jsonparser) library to the [qntfy fork]( https://github.com/qntfy/jsonparser) which adds support array indexing support to the `Set` command. Kazaam now supports transforms which target the setting of specific elements in arrays as well as prepending or appending to arrays.

name: Release v3.2.1
body: This release resolves a bug where only a single UUID would be generated in a specification that required multiple UUIDs due to returning early. The UUID executed was also non-deterministic due to golang's random iteration order for maps.

name: Release v3.2.0
body:
This release adds an `inPlace` option to the shift transform allowing for shuffling of values within the json on top of the source json (ie not starting with a new json document).

This also provides a large bugfix for the UUID transform which previously produced incorrect results.

name: Release v3.1.1
body: Release v3.1.1 removes an improperly included binary (#47) and resolves an issue with the test suite which generated failing JSON comparisons due to map randomization (#48).

name: Release v3.1.0
body: Release v3.1.0 adds support for two new built-in transforms `UUID` (#43) and `Timestamp` (#44).

name: Release v3.0.0
body:
Kazaam is significantly refactored (https://github.com/qntfy/kazaam/pull/40) to use [jsonparser](https://github.com/buger/jsonparser) as the underlying JSON manipulation library, rather than [go-simplejson](https://github.com/bitly/go-simplejson). This results in a 2-10x improvement in time, memory usage and allocations / op for most benchmarks. See details in https://github.com/qntfy/kazaam/pull/35

Kazaam now takes `[]byte` as primary transform input rather than `simplejson.Json` objects. String methods are still supported without change. 

Kazaam no longer provides full JSON validation in all scenarios, but (relatively very slow) `IsJson()` method is provided for convenience for users who wish to validate. Also includes experimental `IsJsonFast()` method which recursively iterates through a json object/array looking for parser errors (we will likely roll this approach into main IsJson() method in a future release).

name: Release Candidate 3 for v3.0.0
body:
Updates from RC2:
- Fix bug where applying `[*]` or `over` in a transform on empty array will cause index out of bound panic.

name: Release Candidate 2 for v3.0.0
body:
Updates from RC1:
- Added experimental `IsJsonFast()` method which recursively iterates through a json object/array looking for parser errors (we will likely roll this approach into main IsJson() method in a future release)
- Incorporates bug fixes in underlying `jsonparser`

name: Release Candidate 1 for v3.0.0
body:
Kazaam is significantly refactored to use [jsonparser](https://github.com/buger/jsonparser) as the underlying JSON manipulation library, rather than [go-simplejson](https://github.com/bitly/go-simplejson). This results in a 2-10x improvement in time, memory usage and allocations / op for most benchmarks. See details in https://github.com/qntfy/kazaam/pull/35

Kazaam now takes `[]byte` as primary transform input rather than `simplejson.Json` objects. String methods are still supported without change. Kazaam no longer provides full JSON validation in all scenarios, but (relatively very slow) `IsJson()` method is provided for convenience for users who wish to validate.

name: Release v2.2.3
body: Adds #31 which fixes an error handling bug affecting multiple operation specs.

name: Release v2.2.2
body: Adds `TransformInPlace` and changes `Transform` to support backwards compatibility. `Transform` remains non-destructive.

name: Release v2.2.1
body:
This release includes a significant refactoring to improve maintainability and readability, bugfixes, as well as significant documentation improvements.

Also new in this release is the added ability to register custom transform types. This can be done using the new Kazaam initialization function `New(spec string, config Config)` function.

name: Release v2.1.1
body: Provides a fix for #26 via #27

name: Release v2.1.0
body: This release adds a`"require"` option, adding path validation support for `shift`, `concat`, and `extract`.

name: Release v2.0.0
body: This release brings full support for `shift`, `concat`, `coalesce`, `default`, and `pass` transforms as well as a CLI for testing specifications.

name: Release v1.3.0
body: Release v1.3.0 includes a new `union` feature which provides the ability to copy a value from the first non-null field in an object.

name: Release v1.2.1
body: Fix issue where `over` feature would cause following transforms to fail.

name: Release v1.2.0
body: Add new `extract` transform.

name: Release v1.1.2
body: Include binary releases of the kazaam command-line driver.

name: Release v1.1.0
body: Add a command-line driver for testing purposes

name: Kazaam v1.0.0
body: Initial public release with full shift/default/pass support and testing.
